intro: Cacalia rufopapposa, commonly known as the red pappus cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with reddish-purple petals and a distinctive, fluffy pappus that aids in seed dispersal. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Cacalia rufopapposa thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
